title: What's the Best Seat in the Game Left, Center, Right?
abstract:
Left, Center, Right is a popular dice game. We analyze the game using Markov
chain and Monte Carlo methods. We compute the expected game length for two to
eight players and determine the probability of winning for each player in the
game. We discuss the surprising conclusions of which players have the highest
and lowest chance of winning, and we propose a small rule change that makes the
game a little more fair.
subjects: Computing Research Repository/Computer Science and Game Theory
